project.teaser: Wind energy takes on a large share in the energy market and will play a crucial role in securing the stability of power grids in the future. However, operation of wind farms, and especially offshore wind farms, are not yet ideal. The operation in fluctuating conditions of wind...
project.objective: Wind energy takes on a large share in the energy market and will play a crucial role in securing the stability of power grids in the future. However, operation of wind farms, and especially offshore wind farms, are not yet ideal. The operation in fluctuating conditions of wind availability and power grids demand as well as the harsh environmental condition where the offshore wind farms are built, have a negative effect on the structure health of the wind turbines, and therefore on their useful lifetime. In this context, WILLOW will develop an integrated system that will provide an open-source, data-driven smart curtailment solution to the Wind Farm Operators with the basis of an integrated Wind Farm Control system looking for a trade-off between the power production and the lifetime consumption. With this aim, WILLOW pretends to design a novel Structural Health Monitoring (SHM) System able to provide high quality data to perform a reliable fleet life assessment using physical models and data-based AI methods which will be used for decision-making and maintenance scheduling. This will contribute to the reduction of the Levelized Cost of Energy (LCOE) and to the increase of the Annual Energy Production (AEP) towards the current trend of design and operating life of offshore wind farms with up to 20 MW turbines beyond 50 years. The WILLOW consortium consists of 12 partners with complementary assets and founded expertise, capable to take on the challenge set out by the topic.
project.title: Wholistic and Integrated digitaL tools for extended Lifetime and profitability of Offshore Wind farms
project.keywords: Offshore wind energy, Wind farm decision-making, O&M cost reduction, LCoE reduction, SHM System, Lifetime extension

article.title: Digital systems to increase lifetime of offshore wind farms

result.title: Communication, Dissemination and Exploitation Plan (CDEP)
result.description: This deliverable will set out the C&D aims, activities, tools and target groups, and exploitation activities. It will outline the project’s audiences, key messages and key channels.

result.title: Project web-site
result.description: This deliverable will be a website ready to be used as main dissemination tool. The website will describe the goals, partners, and research tasks.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: This deliverable will contain the information corresponding to the Open Research Data Pilot (ORDP). It will report on how WILLOW will manage the data generated and ensure the open access to scientific publications, etc.

result.title: Report on stakeholder engagement and activity
result.description: This deliverable will be produced in relation with Task 5.2 “Stakeholder engagement”. It will contain the initial summary of the activities carried out with the Advisory Board in the first year of the project, such as, interactions with the Advisory Board, contributions from stakeholders, results and learning from meetings, etc.

result.title: Communication & Dissemination activities report
result.description: This deliverable will contain the summary of the communication and dissemination activities developed during the first year of the WILLOW project.

result.title: Acceptability requirements and usability guidelines of the WILLOW WF tools
result.description: This deliverable will present the identification of all the relevant needs and functional requirements from potential users of the WILLOW tools.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
